prompt: <description>Part 1: A cylindrical object with a tapered end Construct a cylindrical object with a tapered end. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles 0.0, 0.0, and 0.0 degrees, and translation vector (0.5671, 0.0, 0.0). 1. Sketching the profile: - Draw a circle in face_1 of the coordinate system with center at (0.0518, 0.0518) and radius of 0.0518. This forms loop_1 in face_1. 2. Scaling the profile: - Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.1037. 3. Extruding the profile: - Extrude the sketch by 0.6912 units towards the normal direction. Part 2: A cylindrical object with a slightly tapered end (resembling a pencil or pen) Construct a cylindrical object with a slightly tapered end, similar to a pencil or pen. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles -90.0, 0.0, and -90.0 degrees, and translation vector (0.0, 0.033, 0.6487). 1. Sketching the profile: - Draw a circle in face_1 of the coordinate system with center at (0.0173, 0.0173) and radius of 0.0173. This forms loop_1 in face_1. 2. Scaling the profile: - Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.0346. 3. Extruding the profile: - Extrude the sketch by 0.75 units towards the normal direction. The height of part 1 is 0.6912, width is 0.1037, and length is 0.1037. The height of part 2 is 0.0346, width is 0.75, and length is 0.0346. The final shape: A cylindrical object with a tapered end, resembling a stylized antenna or a simplified representation of a flagpole can be achieved by performing an appropriate Boolean operation on the two parts as mentioned in the JSON description. This is not part of the instructions for constructing the CAD models.</description>

<description>Part 1: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism with a Flat Top and Bottom Step 1: Create the coordinate system Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0313, 0.0375, 0.0313] Step 2: Draw the 2D sketch 1. On the X-Y plane of the newly created coordinate system, draw the first face (face_1) of the prism. 2. For face_1, create loop_1 consisting of 4 straight lines. - line_1: Start Point = [0.0, 0.0], End Point = [0.6875, 0.0] - line_2: Start Point = [0.6875, 0.0], End Point = [0.6875, 0.5625] - line_3: Start Point = [0.6875, 0.5625], End Point = [0.0, 0.5625] - line_4: Start Point = [0.0, 0.5625], End Point = [0.0, 0.0] Step 3: Scale the 2D sketch Scale the 2D sketch uniformly by a factor of 0.6875. Step 4: Extrude the 2D sketch into 3D 1. Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal vector by 0.0375 units. 2. Extrude the 2D sketch in the opposite direction of the normal vector by 0.0 units. 3. Associate the scaling factor of the sketch (sketch_scale) to this extrusion, which is 0.6875. 4. For the Boolean operation, make sure to create a new solid body. Part 2: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism with Flat Top, Bottom and Rounded Corners Step 1: Create the coordinate system Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0375, 0.0] Step 2: Draw the 2D sketch 1. On the X-Y plane of the newly created coordinate system, draw the first face of the prism with rounded corners (face_1) in a similar way as described in Part 1. 2. For face_1, create loop_1 consisting of 4 straight lines and 4 arcs: - line_1, line_2, line_3 and line_4: Identical to the lines in Part 1, loop_1. - arc_1 (top-left): Start Point = [0.0, 0.625], End Point = [0.0, 0.625], Mid Point = [0.0, 0.8125] - arc_2 (top-right): Start Point = [0.75, 0.625], End Point = [0.75, 0.625], Mid Point = [0.75, 0.8125] - arc_3 (bottom-right): Start Point = [0.75, 0.0], End Point = [0.75, 0.0], Mid Point = [0.75, -0.1875] - arc_4 (bottom-left): Start Point = [0.0, 0.0], End Point = [0.0, 0.0], Mid Point = [0.0, -0.1875] Step 3: Scale the 2D sketch Scale the 2D sketch uniformly by a factor of 0.75. Step 4: Extrude the 2D sketch into 3D 1. Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal vector by 0.0125 units. 2. Extrude the 2D sketch in the opposite direction of the normal vector by 0.0 units. 3. Associate the scaling factor of the sketch (sketch\\_scale) to this extrusion, which is 0.75. 4. For the Boolean operation, make sure to join the new body with the previously constructed part.</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1: A rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 and translation vector 0.0, 0.0, 0.0. Sketch the first face with the following: 1. Draw line 1 from (0.0868, 0.0) to (0.6632, 0.0). 2. Draw arc 1 from (0.6632, 0.0) to (0.6632, 0.1736) with midpoint (0.75, 0.0868). 3. Draw line 2 from (0.6632, 0.1736) to (0.0868, 0.1736). 4. Draw arc 2 from (0.0868, 0.1736) to (0.0868, 0.0) with midpoint (0.0, 0.0868). Next, sketch the second face with a circle at the center: 1. Draw circle 1 with center at (0.0868, 0.0868) and radius 0.0358. Lastly, extrude both faces to a height of 0.0419 units using the provided sketch scale factor of 0.75, and perform a NewBodyFeature operation. Part 2: A rectangular prism with a sloped side Create a new coordinate system with euler angles 0.0, 0.0, 0.0, and translation vector (0.217, 0.0334, 0.0419). Sketch the first face with a rectangle: 1. Draw line 1 from (0.0, 0.0) to (0.316, 0.0). 2. Draw line 2 from (0.316, 0.0) to (0.316, 0.1068). 3. Draw line 3 from (0.316, 0.1068) to (0.0, 0.1068). 4. Draw line 4 from (0.0, 0.1068) to (0.0, 0.0). Extrude the sketched face to a height of 0.1256 units using the provided sketch scale factor of 0.316, and perform a JoinFeature operation.</description>

prompt: <description>**Part 1: Three-dimensional, symmetrical, rectangular prism with a rounded top and bottom** **Step 1: Create a new coordinate system** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0396, 0.2591, 0.0] **Step 2: Draw 2D Sketch on the X-Y plane** Proceed by drawing a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane using the new coordinate system. The sketch will be composed of two faces with one loop on each face. **Face 1** Begin by creating a loop on Face 1 with the following components: - Line 1: Start Point: [0.0, 0.4309] End Point: [0.3354, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point: [0.3354, 0.0] End Point: [0.3354, 0.5572] - Arc 1: Start Point: [0.3354, 0.5572] Mid Point: [0.082, 0.7218] End Point: [0.0, 0.4309] **Face 2** Begin by creating a loop on Face 2 with the following components: - Line 1: Start Point: [0.3354, 0.0] End Point: [0.6709, 0.4309] - Arc 1: Start Point: [0.6709, 0.4309] Mid Point: [0.5889, 0.7218] End Point: [0.3354, 0.5572] - Line 2: Start Point: [0.3354, 0.5572] End Point: [0.3354, 0.0] **Step 3: Scale the 2D Sketch** Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.7218. **Step 4: Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch** Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch by defining the sketch plane using the new coordinate system and apply a 3D rotation using the Euler angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0]. **Step 5: Extrude the 3D Sketch** Extrude the transformed 3D sketch along the normal direction with a depth of 0.2591 to create the final 3D part.</description>

prompt: <description>**CAD Model Construction Instructions** We will construct the final shape described in the JSON by creating two intermediate CAD parts. Here are the detailed instructions for each part: `<part_1>` Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. 1. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with Euler angles [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and translation vector [0.0, 0.0139, 0.0]. 2. Draw a 2D sketch on face_1 of the coordinate system. 3. Create loop_1 with the following curves: - line_1 from point [0.0, 0.0] to point [0.75, 0.0] - line_2 from point [0.75, 0.0] to point [0.75, 0.463] - line_3 from point [0.75, 0.463] to point [0.0, 0.463] - line_4 from point [0.0, 0.463] to point [0.0, 0.0] 4. Close the loop to complete the sketch. Now, let's extrude the sketch to create the 3D model: 5. Extrude the sketch by 0.0069 units towards the normal and 0.0069 units opposite the normal. 6. Apply a sketch scale of 0.75 to complete the extrusion. `<part_2>` Construct a rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top and bottom, and a slightly curved side. 1. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with Euler angles [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and translation vector [0.3565, 0.0, 0.1157]. 2. Draw a 2D sketch on face_1 of the coordinate system. 3. Create loop_1 with the following curves: - arc_1 starting at point [0.0, 0.0185], ending at point [0.037, 0.0185], and midpoint [0.0185, 0.0] - line_1 from point [0.037, 0.0185] to point [0.037, 0.1111] - arc_2 starting at point [0.037, 0.1111], ending at point [0.0, 0.1111], and midpoint [0.0185, 0.1296] - line_2 from point [0.0, 0.1111] to point [0.0, 0.0185] 4. Close the loop to complete the sketch. Now, let's extrude the sketch to create the 3D model: 5. Extrude the sketch by a depth of 0.1157 units opposite the normal. 6. Apply a sketch scale of 0.1296 to complete the extrusion. By following these instructions, you will generate an accurate CAD model of the final shape described in the JSON.</description>
